text: The Ovenbird (Seiurus aurocapilla) is a small songbird of the order Passeriformes. Its family is Parulidae. The ovenbird was named after its domed nest with a side entrance, which looks like an oven. This migratory bird is found in eastern North America and winters in Central America, many Caribbean Islands, Florida, and northern Venezuela.Stiles & Skutch (1989), Curson et al. (1994) The ovenbird walks, unlike most other members of its family, which hop. == References == Category:Passeri Category:Birds of North America Category:Birds of Central America
title: Ovenbird
